intro: Tarenna flexilis, commonly known as the flexible tarenna, is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. It is a climbing shrub native to Madagascar, characterized by its slender, twining stems and opposite, ovate leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that are clustered in axillary inflorescences. Its fruits are berries that turn from green to red when mature, containing several seeds. Tarenna flexilis is often found in humid, shaded forest environments, where it thrives in the understory.
